content: jewel box scarf by karin bole jewel box is a simple elegant design in a lightweight all seasons yarn merino / tencel with its delicate sheen makes for a more formal or evening look and the crystal drops add a little weight to the scarf keeping it in place even on a breezy evening beginner with a little crochet experience photo by k bole size one size finished measurements length 152 cm / 60 inches width 18cm / 7 inches materials dkknits technicolor gleem toes 50% merino / 50% tencel 450 yds / 2 7 oz model shown in mermaid tail 1 4 00mm / g-6 crochet hook notions required beads or crystals of your choice model used swarovski crystals beading needle thread to match project if not using project yarn gauge not critical for this project about 5 motifs every 10cm / 4 inches pattern chain 38 or a multiple of 4 + 2 adding 2 for base chain 1st row right side in 5th chain from hook 2dc 2dc into next chain *skip 2ch 2 double_crochet into each of next 2ch repeat from * to last 2ch skip 1ch 1dc in last chain turn 2nd row 3ch *skip 2 sts 2dc into each of next 2 sts repeat from * to last 2 sts skip 1ch 1dc into tch turn repeat 2nd row continue in this manner until your skein is used up or until your scarf is the desired length fasten_off finishing block lightly if desired using thread or left-over project yarn attach your beads or crystals in whatever way looks pleasing to you the model used 3 different colours of swarovski crystals in the barrel shape alternated they were attached in every open ch2 space and in the corners copyright 2006 by karin bole 2006-2008 http //pointeshoespunkrockandpurl blogspot com/ this pattern is for personal use only it may not be used for commercial purposes
